title: Need help with two fonts
content:
I need to identify the “Junior Militant” font (most importantly) and the black text font (not as important but it would help) pictured below. These are off of an old Jamaican-pressed reggae 45, so the quality is pretty poor but if anyone can help I’d appreciate it. I have to recreate these for a reissue in case anyone is wondering. Thanks!

[http://painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020459/http:/painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant1.jpg "http://painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant1.jpg")

[http://painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020459/http:/painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant2.jpg "http://painkillerrecords.com/cm/militant2.jpg")
author: pkr

comments.content:
Check out [Thorowgood](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/thorowgood-regular/thorowgood-ef-regular-italic/) for instance.

—- Tamas Ferencz —-
Thanks for the above two. Anyone have an idea for the black text?

The black text is probably [Monotype Twentieth Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924020459/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/twentieth-century-mt/) (very similar to Futura).

Sean Glenn  
Art Director
